Metadata: Biosynthesis of the marine cyanobacterial metabolite barbamide: 1. origin of the trichloromethyl group

Experiments conducted with the cultured marine cyanobacterium "L. majuscula" show that barbamide biosynthesis involves chlorination of the unactivated "pro- S" methyl group of leucine (or a leucine-derived intermediate), a result which leads to the authors' speculation that novel biochemistry, possibly of a radical nature, may be involved in the chlorination mechanism.
